article.headline: Fordham 70, Manhattan 66
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Brenton Butler scored a game-high 18 points, two more than Michael Binns, as Fordham defeated Manhattan 70-66 Thursday. Bryant Dunston and Marcus Stout each added 11 points for the Rams (3-2), who held a 30-28 lead at halftime. Fordham, the home team, had lost the last five games in the rivalry that started in the 1911-12 season. The Rams now trails 51-48 in the series. Guy Ngarndi's 16 points led the Jaspers (2-4), who lost their third straight. Jamel Ferguson added 15 and Arturo Dubois added 14 for Manhattan. After Dubois' layup tied the score at 4-4, the Rams scored 12 unanswered points for a 16-4 advantage at 13:59. Binns contributed five points including a 3-pointer, and Kevin Anderson added two jump shots. Darryl Crawford's 3-point play closed out an 8-1 rally that got the Jaspers to within 17-12 at 9:49. Butler's 3-point basket put Fordham ahead 24-18 with just more than five minutes left in the first half. Two foul shots by Ferguson gave the Jaspers their first lead of the game 32-30 at 17:42 of the second half. A jumper by Crawford increased the margin to 41-36 at 13:05. The Rams then responded with an 11-2 run behind Butler's five points for a 47-43 edge.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
